text: Pasquale de' Rossi (* 1641 in Vicenza; † 28. Juni 1722 in Rome), also known as Pasqualino de' Rossi, was an Italian painter of the Baroque period. Born in Vicenza, he was mostly self-trained in design. He painted a Baptism of Christ for the Montemirabile Chapel in the Basilica of Santa Maria del Popolo in Rome and also painted much for the Royal Palace of Turin. ==References== * * Category:1641 births Category:People from Vicenza Category:17th-century Italian painters Category:Italian male painters Category:Vicenzan painters Category:Italian Baroque painters Category:Year of death unknown
title: Pasquale de' Rossi
